intro: Matelea elliptica, commonly known as the Mexican moonflower, is a species of flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related plants. The plant is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that open at night and close during the day. Its leaves are elliptical and often have a velvety texture, while the stems are woody and branching. Matelea elliptica is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
